channel.title: Comments on: Atheist Christopher Hitchens to Skip Prayer Day in His Honor

item.title: By: EJH
item.dc:creator: EJH
item.description: What a sad sad story. I think I will join the third group and pray that God would heal him...completely.
item.content:encoded: What a sad sad story. I think I will join the third group and pray that God would heal him…completely.

item.title: By: Bill Brown
item.dc:creator: Bill Brown
item.description: There is no joy in Christopher Hitchens' refusal to pray. The heart is desperately wicked and easily hardened. No pithy aphorism about how Hitchens is "getting what's coming to him" is necessary or appropriate among believers. The article records Hitchens as saying, "All of us are dying." That is true. Some are dying physically only, while others are dying physically and spiritually. Those who have been born from above will one day graduate from this earthly tent. Sin and death will lose its last weak hold on them. The latter group is dead while they live. They go from death to death.
item.content:encoded: There is no joy in Christopher Hitchens’ refusal to pray. The heart is desperately wicked and easily hardened. No pithy aphorism about how Hitchens is “getting what’s coming to him” is necessary or appropriate among believers. The article records Hitchens as saying, “All of us are dying.” That is true. Some are dying physically only, while others are dying physically and spiritually. Those who have been born from above will one day graduate from this earthly tent. Sin and death will lose its last weak hold on them. The latter group is dead while they live. They go from death to death.
